content.raw:
Thanks for merging! 

I'll start to transition all our lab machines to python 3 for productive use today. If we missed something ist should become obvious quite soon.
content.html:
Thanks for merging!

I'll start to transition all our lab machines to python 3 for productive use today. If we missed something ist should become obvious quite soon.

update.description:
This should make BLACS run under Python 3 in a backwards compatible way. Most changes are trivial.

A few adjustments had to be made to the front panel settings and connectiontable as the numpy arrays stored in the hdf5 files have byte strings that need to be converted.

Also the queue.py file had to be renamed due to the name collision with the queue module in Python3.

* Added future import to all files
* Python3 adjustments
* ~~made connectiontable handle bytestrings better~~
* ~~renamed queue.py to experiment\_queue.py to resolve bug, where instead of the queue module blacs.queue would be loaded by other modules~~
* ~~cleaner solution to the dtypes problem~~
* ~~renamed blacs\_queue to the more fiting experiment\_queue~~

To test this the qtutils Python3 changes must have been made before.
update.title: Python3

content.raw: I just googled what cpickle is called in python3 and got \_pickle so I guess that is why I use it. I'll have a quick check if changing it to pickle will work and then change it.
content.html: I just googled what cpickle is called in python3 and got _pickle so I guess that is why I use it. I'll have a quick check if changing it to pickle will work and then change it.

content.raw:
This is all pretty obvious stuff, should be able to merge soon.

Is there a reason you used `_pickle` instead of `pickle?`

As far as I know, typical cross-version code for that import would be:

```
if PY2:
    import cPickle as pickle
else:
    import pickle
```

It's true that `_pickle` is what cPickle is called in Python 3, but importing `pickle` by itself will use `_pickle`, if it's available.
content.html:
This is all pretty obvious stuff, should be able to merge soon.

Is there a reason you used _pickle instead of pickle?

As far as I know, typical cross-version code for that import would be:

if PY2:
    import cPickle as pickle
else:
    import pickle

It's true that _pickle is what cPickle is called in Python 3, but importing pickle by itself will use _pickle, if it's available.

* It now uses `numpy_dtype_workaround`
* It includes the changes from the [Move connections.py to labscript\_utils](#!/labscript_suite/blacs/pull-requests/28) pull request
* It now includes python3 changes for the delete repeated shots plugin

update.title: Python3

update.description:
This should make BLACS run under Python 3 in a backwards compatible way. Most changes are trivial.

A few adjustments had to be made to the front panel settings and connectiontable as the numpy arrays stored in the hdf5 files have byte strings that need to be converted.

Also the [queue.py](http://queue.py) file had to be renamed due to the name collision with the queue module in Python3.

* Added future import to all files
* Python3 adjustments
* made connectiontable handle bytestrings better
* renamed queue.py to experiment\_queue.py to resolve bug, where instead of the queue module blacs.queue would be loaded by other modules
* cleaner solution to the dtypes problem
* renamed blacs\_queue to the more fiting experiment\_queue

To test this the [qtutils Python3 changes](https://pstarkey.github.io/bitbucket-archive/#!/pull-requests/2/python-3/diff) must have been made before.
update.title: Python3

* Added future import to all files
* Python3 adjustments
* made connectiontable handle bytestrings better
* renamed queue.py to experiment\_queue.py to resolve bug, where instead of the queue module blacs.queue would be loaded by other modules
* cleaner solution to the dtypes problem
* renamed blacs\_queue to the more fiting experiment\_queue

To test this the [qtutils Python3 changes](https://pstarkey.github.io/bitbucket-archive/#!/pull-requests/2/python-3/diff) must have been made before.

content.raw:
When the two smaller pull requests are merged I will update this one here and resolve all conflicts.

This should then make the changes made to the queue.py file more visible as bitbucket/mercurial doesn't handle renaming and changing files at the same time well.
content.html:
When the two smaller pull requests are merged I will update this one here and resolve all conflicts.

This should then make the changes made to the queue.py file more visible as bitbucket/mercurial doesn't handle renaming and changing files at the same time well.

The changes will be very minimal to make it easy to merge them quickly.

I'll split a few changes from this pull request into their own pull request to make this one here more readable:

update.description:
This should make BLACS run under Python 3 in a backwards compatible way. Most changes are trivial.

A few adjustments had to be made to the front panel settings and connectiontable as the numpy arrays stored in the hdf5 files have byte strings that need to be converted.

Also the [queue.py](http://queue.py) file had to be renamed due to the name collision with the queue module in Python3.

* Added future import to all files
* Python3 adjustments
* made connectiontable handle bytestrings better
* renamed queue.py to experiment\_queue.py to resolve bug, where instead of the queue module blacs.queue would be loaded by other modules
* cleaner solution to the dtypes problem
* renamed blacs\_queue to the more fiting experiment\_queue

To test this the [qtutils Python3 changes](https://pstarkey.github.io/bitbucket-archive/#!/pull-requests/2/python-3/diff) must have been made before.
update.title: Python3
